meanings.definition: Resembling a trout in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The fish in the stream looked troutier than the ones in the lake.
meanings.sent2: Her movements were graceful and troutier, just like a fish swimming in the water.
meanings.sent3: The troutier wig she wore made her look like a fish out of water.
meanings.sent4: His troutier behavior at the party stood out like a colorful fish in a dull pond.
meanings.sent5: The troutier colors of the painting made it seem alive, like a fish leaping from the canvas.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a trout.
meanings.sent1: The dish had a troutier taste than any other fish I had tried.
meanings.sent2: His troutier features, like the pointed nose and wide eyes, reminded me of a fish.
meanings.sent3: She had a troutier personality, always swimming against the current of popular opinion.
meanings.sent4: The troutier scent of the river brought back memories of fishing trips with my grandfather.
meanings.sent5: The troutier texture of the fabric felt smooth and slippery, like a fish's scales.

meanings.sent1: The troutier waters of the mountain stream were teeming with fish.
meanings.sent2: The troutier section of the river was a favorite spot for anglers.
meanings.sent3: The troutier display at the aquarium drew a large crowd of visitors.
meanings.sent4: The troutier menu at the seafood restaurant featured various trout dishes.
meanings.sent5: The troutier landscape of the national park was a haven for fishing enthusiasts.
